FuncDef:
The bind location-group command binds a PW-VE interface (main interface) to a location group.
The undo bind location-group command unbinds a PW-VE interface (main interface) from a location group.
By default, no PW-VE interface is bound to a location group.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the name of a location group.
The value is a string of 1 to 63 characters.

Examples: Warning: This command will configure the system to be CU mode, bras command can not take effect. Continue? [Y/N]:y
Info: This command will set the default configuration to invalid.
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To bind a PW-VE interface to a location group, run the bind location-group command so that services on the PW-VE interface are processed on the board where the interface bound to the location group resides.
Precautions
A PW-VE main interface can be bound to only one location group, and no PW-VE sub-interface can be bound to a location group. If the bind location-group command is run more than once in the PW-VE interface view, the latest configuration takes effect only when no user is online on the PW-VE interface.
